docs.title: Welcome to the AI Learning Hub
docs.description: Choose your path by audience and experience level, then dive into quickstarts, concepts, evaluations, and patterns.

docs.title: Agents vs. classic automation
docs.description: Decide when to reach for multi-step AI agents and when deterministic automation is faster, cheaper, and safer.

docs.title: Placing GenAI among ML, expert systems, and RPA
docs.description: Compare classical automation approaches so you can select the right blend of rules, models, and agents for each business problem.

docs.title: Caching and retry strategies for GenAI apps
docs.description: Reduce cost and flakiness in AI applications with pragmatic caching layers, retry policies, and observability hooks.

docs.title: Concepts: Embeddings fundamentals
docs.description: Understand what embeddings are, how to choose dimensions and models, and how to normalize vectors for search and analytics.

docs.title: Responsible AI essentials
docs.description: Practical guardrails for bias, transparency, and human oversight in applied AI teams.

docs.title: Generative AI vs. Agentic Systems
docs.description: Compare single-shot prompting with multi-step, tool-using agents so you can decide which approach fits your problem.

docs.title: AI glossary
docs.description: Concise definitions for common AI terms used throughout the hub.

docs.title: Multimodal model fundamentals
docs.description: Learn how text, image, and audio-capable foundation models ingest data, what design patterns they enable, and how to evaluate them safely.

docs.title: Prompting styles and when to use them
docs.description: Instruction, few-shot, chain-of-thought, critique-and-repair, and planning prompts with tradeoffs and runnable examples.

docs.title: Safety basics for AI projects
docs.description: Identify common risks (jailbreaks, leakage, toxicity) and apply a lightweight checklist to new AI prototypes.

docs.title: Safety risk taxonomy
docs.description: Classify GenAI risks by impact and likelihood, and map them to mitigations and owners.

docs.title: Spec-first vs. vibe-based coding with LLMs
docs.description: Learn how lightweight specs, evals, and guardrails keep AI-assisted development on track compared with improvisational prompting.

docs.title: Structured outputs in practice
docs.description: Design JSON schemas, validate responses, and choose providers that support constrained generation.

docs.title: Tokens, context windows, and latency
docs.description: Understand how tokens, context windows, and streaming influence cost and response times.

docs.title: What is Generative AI?
docs.description: Understand how generative models produce text, images, and code, what they do well, and when to reach for other techniques.

docs.title: Data platform benchmarks
docs.description: Benchmark end-to-end GenAI workflows that query Fabric, Snowflake, Databricks, or Qlik Cloud so you can size infrastructure correctly.

docs.title: Grounded QA evaluations
docs.description: Measure whether retrieval-augmented answers stay faithful to source documents and cite evidence correctly.

docs.title: Latency–cost tradeoffs
docs.description: Instrument GenAI systems to balance perceived speed with spend using model selection, streaming, caching, and batching.

docs.title: Offline batch evaluations
docs.description: Automate nightly or on-demand evaluation runs that replay golden datasets, score outputs, and surface regressions fast.

docs.title: Evaluations overview
docs.description: Establish goals, datasets, scoring methods, and feedback loops so GenAI systems improve without guesswork.

docs.title: Rubric prompts
docs.description: Design precise scoring prompts that grade correctness, tone, safety, and structure with repeatable outputs.

docs.title: Tool-use evaluations
docs.description: Measure function-calling success, latency, and safety when models invoke tools in workflows.

docs.title: Example: Agent-to-agent coordination
docs.description: Orchestrate a planner and executor agent that collaborate on QA tasks with budgets, confidence scoring, and human handoffs.

docs.title: Example: AI customer support triage
docs.description: Design a router agent that classifies inbound tickets, drafts internal notes, and escalates safely.

docs.title: Example: Content drafter
docs.description: Build a writing assistant with tone controls, iteration loops, and a review rubric.

docs.title: Example: Data quality QA assistant
docs.description: Run read-only checks against databases and APIs, score issues, and surface false positives.

docs.title: Example: Data science notebook helper
docs.description: Assist analysts in Jupyter/Colab notebooks with code suggestions, data quality checks, and experiment tracking.

docs.title: Example: Education lesson planner
docs.description: Create differentiated lesson plans aligned to learning objectives, assessments, and classroom constraints.

docs.title: Example: Finance expense audit assistant
docs.description: Flag anomalous expenses, route high-risk items, and document review trails for finance teams.

docs.title: Example: Healthcare intake assistant
docs.description: Collect patient intake details with consent prompts, triage hints, and privacy safeguards.

docs.title: Example: HR candidate screening assistant
docs.description: Summarize resumes, extract skills, and document fairness considerations before recruiter review.

docs.title: Example: IT knowledge base assistant
docs.description: Ground internal IT support answers in documented SOPs with citations and escalation logic.

docs.title: Example: Legal clause extractor
docs.description: Identify and summarize contract clauses with structured outputs and human-in-the-loop review.

docs.title: Example: Marketing campaign brief generator
docs.description: Compile product positioning, audience insights, and channel plans into a structured brief for creative teams.

docs.title: Example: Meeting summarizer
docs.description: Generate structured minutes, decisions, and action items with traceable context.

docs.title: Example: Provider switching playbook
docs.description: Build a thin abstraction so you can route GenAI workloads between OpenAI and Anthropic with minimal downtime.

docs.title: Example: Research citation checker
docs.description: Verify claims in research drafts by validating citations, detecting broken links, and surfacing primary sources.

docs.title: Example: Sales email drafter
docs.description: Generate persona-aware outreach emails with compliance checkpoints and adaptive follow-ups.

docs.title: Example: Software code reviewer assistant
docs.description: Augment pull request reviews with static checks, test suggestions, and risk notes.

docs.title: Example: Toolformer-style information extractor
docs.description: Teach an LLM to trigger data-extraction tools only when useful, combining free-form reasoning with structured outputs.

docs.title: Example: Translation quality checker
docs.description: Evaluate multilingual content for accuracy, tone, and regulatory requirements before publication.

docs.title: Operations: Admin dashboard for sync health
docs.description: Build a lightweight dashboard that tracks documentation sync status, manifest hashes, and webhook freshness.

docs.title: Operations: Environment variables and health checks
docs.description: Map every environment variable, share safe defaults, and expose a dependable health check for AI services.

docs.title: Operations: GitHub flow for documentation releases
docs.description: Standardize how contributors branch, review, and publish documentation so the manifest and site stay healthy.

docs.title: Agent‑to‑Agent (A2A) Collaboration
docs.description: Patterns for agents to hand off tasks, negotiate, and escalate to humans.

docs.title: Cost controls for AI apps
docs.description: Apply token budgets, truncation, caching, and adaptive model selection to manage spend without sacrificing quality.

docs.title: Observability for AI context
docs.description: Log actionable metadata for LLM calls while protecting user privacy and enabling traceability across tools.

docs.title: Compare Providers: Request Shapes and Tradeoffs
docs.description: Contrast OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, and Anthropic across authentication, request formats, safety levers, and operational considerations.

docs.title: Security Best Practices for AI Providers
docs.description: Handle keys, proxies, rotation, and logging safely across environments.

docs.title: Getting started: Your first AI idea
docs.description: A 10-minute guided worksheet to turn an idea into a concrete project brief with success metrics and next steps.

docs.title: JS/TS Server Route: Safe Provider Calls
docs.description: Implement a server-only route that calls OpenAI (or any LLM API) with retries, streaming, and guardrails.

docs.title: Python FastAPI Endpoint for AI
docs.description: Ship a minimal-yet-safe FastAPI endpoint that calls OpenAI, returns structured JSON, and includes retries, timeouts, and monitoring hooks.

docs.title: Try GenAI in 10 minutes
docs.description: Spin up a safe server-side endpoint in Node or Python that calls OpenAI and returns a structured response.

docs.title: Human-in-the-loop
docs.description: Introduce review queues and approval gates so humans can supervise sensitive GenAI outputs and actions.

docs.title: Output filters
docs.description: Combine rule-based and model-based filters to block, redact, or escalate unsafe AI responses before delivery.

docs.title: Safety and responsible AI overview
docs.description: Establish safety pillars, governance roles, and incident response for GenAI features across your organization.

docs.title: Prompt safety
docs.description: Write prompts that minimize risk by scoping behavior, enforcing refusals, and protecting sensitive data.

docs.title: Tutorial: Agentic Helpdesk
docs.description: Build a helpdesk agent with tools (ticketing, search), plus a quick eval loop to verify outputs.

docs.title: Analytics assistants for Qlik Cloud and Power BI
docs.description: Build a governed analytics assistant that drafts visuals, narratives, and QA checks for Qlik Cloud and Power BI users.

docs.title: Tutorial: Cost guardrails
docs.description: Implement budgets and alerts across routes; add token caps, streaming, and summaries.

docs.title: Build a dbt assistant with LLM scaffolding
docs.description: Use large language models to scaffold dbt models, tests, and documentation with human review gates and automated checks.

docs.title: Next.js + Prisma + SQLite to Vercel deployment
docs.description: Build an App Router project backed by Prisma and SQLite, then deploy it to Vercel with environment-safe settings.

docs.title: Tutorial: Observability end-to-end
docs.description: Add logs, traces, and dashboards for AI routes with sampling and PII safeguards.

docs.title: Tutorial: Prisma + Postgres for Sessions
docs.description: Model session storage with Prisma, run migrations, and support rollbacks.

docs.title: Tutorial: Production hardening
docs.description: Implement retries, rate limits, backpressure, and circuit breakers for resilient AI services.

docs.title: FastAPI + SQLite AI session service
docs.description: Build a FastAPI backend that stores chat sessions in SQLite, calls an AI provider with retries, and exposes a typed API.

docs.description: Create a minimal RAG system with dataset curation, chunking, retrieval, and an evaluation loop.

docs.title: SQL-aware agent patterns for analytics teams

docs.title: Pattern: Planner–executor agent loop
docs.description: Coordinate a planning model with specialized executors, tools, and guardrails for multi-step tasks.

docs.title: Router Agent: Multi-Tool Selection
docs.description: Design a router that classifies intents, selects the right tool, and enforces guardrails across a multi-provider stack.

docs.title: Prompting recipe patterns
docs.description: A reusable library of prompt templates for instruction following, reasoning, critique, and retrieval-backed tasks.

docs.description: Blend sparse and dense retrieval with reranking to maximize relevance and citation quality.

docs.description: Capture metrics, datasets, thresholds, and reviewer workflows so AI teams can run consistent evaluations.

docs.title: OpenAI: Auth, Models, and Limits
docs.description: Configure authentication safely, choose models intentionally, and stay within rate and token limits when using the OpenAI API.
